Statistics Programming

This document excerpt is an introduction to the book "Statistics Programming", which focuses on using Python for data analysis and statistical computation. The book is targeted towards practitioners who already possess programming skills and want to leverage them for understanding and analyzing data through the lens of probability and statistics. It presents a concise and practical introduction to the Python data analysis stack, emphasizing computational methods over purely mathematical approaches. The core of the book revolves around a single, comprehensive case study, guiding readers through the entire process of exploratory data analysis ‚Äì from data collection and initial statistical calculations to pattern identification and hypothesis testing. Readers will gain proficiency in utilizing a wide range of tools and concepts, including distributions, rules of probability, visualization techniques, and various statistical methods. Crucially, the book promotes a hands-on learning experience, encouraging readers to develop their coding skills while conducting experiments and simulations to solidify their understanding of complex statistical concepts. The excerpt highlights the inclusion of new chapters dedicated to advanced topics such as regression analysis, time series analysis, survival analysis, and analytic methods, broadening the scope of the book's coverage. Ultimately, "Statistics Programming" aims to equip readers with the ability to transform raw data into actionable knowledge by combining programming skills with statistical principles. The book's approach is designed to make statistical concepts more accessible and understandable through practical application and coding exercises.

Key Concepts:

  • This book provides a comprehensive introduction to Python data analysis.
  • The book focuses on computationally performing statistical analysis rather than relying solely on mathematical formulas.
  • The book uses a single case study to guide the reader through the entire process of exploratory data analysis, including data collection, statistical analysis, and hypothesis testing.
  • Key concepts include distributions, rules of probability, visualization, and statistical modeling.
  • Testing a Linear Model
  • Weighted Resampling
  • Estimating Parameters
  • Importing and Cleaning
  • Plotting
  • Survival Curves
